com.moniuliuma.android.input

Class KeyboardManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.moniuliuma.android.input.KeyboardManager

  • public class KeyboardManager
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides access to keyboard related methods of the terminal.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes

      class  KeyboardManager.VScanCode
      Virtual key scan codes.

        public void lockInput(boolean lock)
        Lock or unlock the input from keyboard.
        Parameters:

      • isInputLocked

        public boolean isInputLocked()
        Tells if the input from keyboard is locked.
        Returns:
        It returns whether or not the keyboard is locked.

      • mapKeyCode

        public void mapKeyCode(VScanEntry scanCode,
                       KeyCodeEntry keyCode)
        Assigns a virtual key code to a physical key. If a mapping for the desired physical key is already assigned and saved, it will be overridden.
        Parameters:
        scanCode - Virtual scan code and modifiers state.
        keyCode - Android key code and modifiers state.

        Example code to avoid any keyboard event on the left scan trigger pressure:
        (new KeyboardManager()).mapKeyCode(new KeyboardMapEntry(VScanCode.VSCAN_LEFT_TRIGGER), new KeyboardMapEntry(KeyEvent.KEYCODE_UNKNOWN));

        Example code to map the left scan trigger to the Android left trigger button key code:
        (new KeyboardManager()).mapKeyCode(new KeyboardMapEntry(VScanCode.VSCAN_LEFT_TRIGGER), new KeyboardMapEntry(KeyEvent.KEYCODE_BUTTON_L1));

        Example code to map the enter+blue key to the Android home key code:
        (new KeyboardManager()).mapKeyCode(new KeyboardMapEntry(VScanCode.VSCAN_RIGHT_ENTER, KeyboardModifier.BLUE_STATE), new KeyboardMapEntry(KeyEvent.KEYCODE_HOME));

        See Also:
        KeyCodeEntry

      • getKeyCode

        public KeyCodeEntry getKeyCode(VScanEntry scanCode)
        Returns current mapping between a physical key and a virtual key code.
        Parameters:
        scanCode - Virtual scan code and modifiers state.
        Returns:
        Android key code and modifiers state. Returns null in case there is no association.
        See Also:
        VScanEntry

      • mapUnicode

        public void mapUnicode(VScanEntry scanCode,
                       java.lang.Character c)
        Assigns a unicode character to a physical key. If a mapping for the desired physical key is already assigned and saved, it will be overridden.
        Parameters:
        scanCode - Virtual scan code and modifiers state.
        c - unicode character

        Example code to assign a Thai unicode character to the physical key '1':
        (new KeyboardManager()).mapUnicode(new KeyboardMapEntry(VScanCode.VSCAN_1), '\\u0e01');

        See Also:
        VScanEntry

      • getUnicode

        public java.lang.Character getUnicode(VScanEntry scanCode)
        Returns current mapping between a physical key and a unicode character.
        Parameters:
        scanCode - Virtual scan code and modifiers state.
        Returns:
        unicode character. Returns null in case there is no association.
        See Also:
        VScanEntry

      • mapIntent

        public void mapIntent(VScanEntry scanCode,
                      android.content.Intent intent)
        Assigns an Intent to a physical key. If a mapping for the desired physical key is already assigned and saved, it will be overridden.
        Parameters:
        scanCode - Virtual scan code and modifiers state.
        intent - Intent used to launch an Android activity through the Context.startActivity(Intent intent) method.

        Example code to make Camera Activity capture an image on the front scan trigger pressure:
        (new KeyboardManager()).mapIntent(new KeyboardMapEntry(VScanCode.VSCAN_FRONT_TRIGGER), new Intent(MediaStore.ACTION_IMAGE_CAPTURE));

        Example code to make BarcodeManager capture a barcode on the front scan trigger pressure and to stop capturing on the front scan trigger release:
        (new KeyboardManager()).mapIntent(new KeyboardMapEntry(VScanCode.VSCAN_FRONT_TRIGGER), new Intent(BarcodeManager.ACTION_BARCODE_CAPTURE));

        See Also:
        VScanEntry

      • getIntent

        public android.content.Intent getIntent(VScanEntry scanCode)
        Returns current mapping between a physical key and an Intent.
        Parameters:
        scanCode - Virtual scan code and modifiers state.
        Returns:
        Intent used to launch an Android activity through the Context.startActivity(Intent intent) method. Returns null in case there is no association.
        See Also:
        VScanEntry

      • clearAllMappings

        public void clearAllMappings()
        Removes all the configured mappings. Whenever this method is called, all the current active mappings are cleared and removed.

      • clearMapping

        public void clearMapping(VScanEntry scanCode)
        Removes a single active mapping. The current active mapping for the selected VScanEntry, if existing, is removed.Removes a single active mapping. The current active mapping for the selected VScanEntry, if existing, is removed.
        Parameters:
        scanCode - the corresponding saved mapping that must be removed.

      • getMappedKeyCodes

        public java.util.Map<VScanEntry,KeyCodeEntry> getMappedKeyCodes()
        Provides a Map< VScanEntry, KeyboardMapEntry> containing all the stored and active Android keycodes mappings.
        Returns:
        Map< VScanEntry, KeyboardMapEntry> the corresponding saved mappings. Null is returned if there aren't any mappings saved.

      • getMappedIntents

        public java.util.Map<VScanEntry,android.content.Intent> getMappedIntents()
        Provides a Map< VScanEntry, android.content.Intent > containing all the stored and active Android Intent mappings.
        Returns:
        Map< VScanEntry, android.content.Intent > the corresponding saved mappings. Null is returned if there aren't any mappings saved.

      • getMappedUnicodes

        public java.util.Map<VScanEntry,java.lang.Character> getMappedUnicodes()
        Provides a Map< VScanEntry, Character> containing all the stored and active Character mappings.
        Returns:
        Map< VScanEntry, Character> the corresponding saved mappings. Null is returned if there aren't any mappings saved.
